qas.question: When did the plague return to Europe?
What did Biraben say about the plague in Europe?

answers.text: the plague was present somewhere in Europe in every year between 1346 and 1671.
was present somewhere in Europe in every year between 1346 and 1671
the plague was present somewhere in Europe in every year between 1346 and 1671

qas.question: How many French people were lost to plague between 1628-31?
When did the First Pandemic end?
How many people died from the Black Death in Northern  Africa?

context: The plague repeatedly returned to haunt Europe and the Mediterranean <a0_0>throughout the <a0_1><a0_2>14th to 17th centuries<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. According to Biraben, <a1_0><a1_2>the plague <a1_1>was present somewhere in Europe in every year between <b4_0>1346<b4_0/> and 1671<a1_2/><a1_1/>.<a1_0/> The Second Pandemic was particularly widespread in the following years: 1360–63; 1374; 1400; 1438–39; 1456–57; 1464–66; 1481–85; 1500–03; 1518–31; 1544–48; 1563–66; 1573–88; 1596–99; 1602–11; 1623–40; 1644–54; and 1664–67. Subsequent outbreaks, though severe, marked the retreat from most of Europe (18th century) and <b6_0>northern Africa<b6_0/> (19th century). According to <b3_0>Geoffrey<b3_0/> Parker, "<b5_0>France<b5_0/> alone lost <a2_0><a2_1>almost <a2_2><b7_0>a million<a2_2/> people<b7_0/><a2_1/><a2_0/> to the plague in the epidemic of 1628–31."
